Subjects: meditations; Christ, prayers to; prayers, to Christ
_description: ‘A deuoyt meditacione’ — twenty-two 8-line stanzas (ababcdcd) with refrain: ‘Ihesu mercy for my mysdede’

CamTCC223.First Lines:
Ihesu mercy mercy I ceþ myn vgly synnes þu me
                    forgyfeþe werlde my flesche þe fende fellþþai me
                    besale both sranget styfe…
CamTCC223.Last Lines:
…Mercy þu graunt amen amenIhesu mercy for my myse
                    dede
CamTCC223.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 103-8; rev. ed. 133-8.
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 75-80.

Chetham6691.First Lines:
Ihesu Ihesu mercy I cryMyn huge synnes þou me
                    forgyfþe werld my flesch þe fend fellyþei me be sette
                    boþe strong & styf…
Chetham6691.Last Lines:
…Mercy þou grante amen amenIhesu mercy for my
                    mysdede
Chetham6691.Attributed Title: Incipit oracio deuota ad dominum Ihesum. Oracio (f. 133)
Chetham6691.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 222-70.
